artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 482.4; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 207, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets; man lying on his stomach with his upper body on a low table; man wears grey kimono with white patterns; man's hairy leg emerging from kimono; sword, LLC; woman at top of right image at center of spider web, in profile from right, wearing brown kimono with white circles and green dots in floral pattern; grey ground
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 円活刀{Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sketches by Yoshitoshi (Yoshitoshi manga 芳年漫画)
title: Picture of the Earth Spider Monster Mentally Tormenting Sakata Kintoki and Others During the Night Guard in the Chambers of Minamoto Yorimitsu in the Fall of 976
